title: Em
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101095641/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101095641/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Em**

Pronounced like it is spelled, an em is a measurement equal to the current point size. An [em dash](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101095641/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Em%20Dash) is a dash the width of the given em. Because “em” and “en” sound so much alike, the em is sometimes referred to as the “mutton.”

See the related [en](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101095641/http:/typophile.com/wiki/En).

**Discussion:**  
 [The Em](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101095641/http:/typophile.com/node/27742)

**Additional Articles:**  
 [The Em](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101095641/http:/type101.fontbureau.com/archives/36), by Cyrus Highsmith.

author: Thomas Phinney
